title: Who win the next Iranian presidential election?
possible_answers: None of these or there will be no election before 26 June 2021
preds:
According to western press reports, Iranian voters have a limited choice in the Presidential election, 2021.
Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has manipulated a like-minded hardliner will become the new president.
The one reformist candidate, Mohsen Mehralizadeh and a hardliner, Alireza Zakani dropped out leaving five candidates in the field, which is familiar ploy in Iranian presidential elections to ensure the election of similar individuals.
The former governor of the Central Bank of Iran Abdolnasar Hemmati, who is a moderate and a member of the political establishment may have stood an outside chance but, opinion is ‘that Iranians are exhausted form years of corruption, sanctions, economic volatility and grown apathetic to these elections’.  https://www.france24.com/en/asia-pacific/20210616-reformist-mehralizadeh-drops-out-of-iran-presidential-election-race  https://www.cfr.org/in-brief/irans-presidential-election-what-know  https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/iransource/hemmati-the-dark-horse-of-the-iranian-presidential-election/  https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2021/jun/13/the-observer-view-on-iran-election

"Mohsen Mehralizadeh, the only reformist candidate approved to participate in this week's Iranian presidential election, has withdrawn from the race leaving former central bank governor Abdolnaser Hemmati as the sole non-conservative on the ballot."
https://www.argusmedia.com/en/news/2225193-sole-reformist-candidate-drops-out-of-iran-election

This German site says Hemmati won yesterdays TV debate, according to Iranian polls (there is no english version):
https://www.bpb.de/internationales/asien/iran/334633/hintergrund-praesidentschaftswahl-2021 https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/6/12/irans-presidential-candidates-pull-out-the-stops-in-final-debate
Hemmati is the only moderate candidate, but probably won't have a chance against Raisi.
Latest Iran poll shows Raisi with 48%, others with less than 5%, and 44.2% undecided according to wikipedia. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Iranian_presidential_election#Opinion_polls
Raisi is the front runner or there will be instability caused by the regional politics
Recent news on Hemmati is almost certainly over-valued. The most likely surprises will be to the system, not to the election, leading to a postponement.

+6 on Hemmati due to speculation in a recent article that he could be the moderate people gather around. Not putting much weight on it yet though because I didn't see any polling with the article, just sounded like speculation.
The regime wants Raisi to win.

Raisi is the clear frontrunner and has close ties to Khamenei. What more needs to be said? https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-57243630
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/may/25/irans-leadership-accused-of-fixing-presidential-election
Using the extremely complex strategy of trusting media reports that Raisi's win has been engineered and then assigning the rest based on the ones that have polling results on Wikipedia.
Judiciary chief Ebrahim Raisi will now be seen as the clear frontrunner to succeed Hassan Rouhani, a moderate.

Ebrahim Raisi is a hardliner amongst six other inconsequential candidates selected by Iran’s Guardian Council to run for office in the forthcoming Presidential election.
Political commentators have been predicting a low turnout due to voter apathy driven by the primary concern of the country’s dire economic situation and a scepticism that their votes will make any difference. 
The opinion in Iran is that a low voter turnout (less than 50%) gives advantage to the Conservatives. A high turnout would benefit the reformist camp and have therefore been excluded from the list of those allowed to run for President. A further message was sent by Morteza Agha-Tehrani, an ultraconservative member of the Iranian parliament, threatening the disqualified candidates to ‘correct themselves before the regimes toleration wears out and rounds you up’, that will perhaps sort dissipate any dissent. Moderates tend to win elections in Iran when allowed to run and so hardliners play a game of repressing the most promising political moderate candidates and there is an opinion that this election is not only disqualify rivals but delete their philosophies from the political landscape. Given that six of the candidates are to make up the numbers and the voter will be low Raisi appears to be in pole position. https://www.fes.de/en/referat-naher-mittlerer-osten-und-nordafrika/iran-elections/artikelseite-iranelections/wirtschaftskrise-und-wahlbeteiligung-in-iran  https://www.fes.de/en/referat-naher-mittlerer-osten-und-nordafrika/iran-elections/artikelseite-iranelections/eine-kritische-phase-eine-emiratische-perspektive-auf-die-praesidentschaftswahlen-in-iran  https://www.fes.de/en/referat-naher-mittlerer-osten-und-nordafrika/iran-elections/artikelseite-iranelections/spaetes-crescendo-mit-grossem-finale-wie-in-iran-wahlkampf-gemacht-wird
https://iranintl.com/en/iran/iran-official-poll-shows-lower-turnout-after-elimination-key-candidates  https://iranintl.com/en/iran/qom-clerics-join-criticism-‘stage-managed’-iran-presidential-election
https://iranintl.com/en/iran/ahmadinejads-ex-mentor-threatens-irans-disqualified-candidates
https://www.voanews.com/middle-east/iran-presidential-election-feature-7-candidates
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/5/25/irans-guardian-council-disqualifies-most-presidential-candidates  https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/hardline-cleric-ebrahim-raisi-conservative-iran-presidential-election-v6wtwcx8t  https://time.com/6052474/iran-presidential-elections-ebrahim-raisi/  https://foreignpolicy.com/2021/05/27/iran-election-raisi-larijani-islamic-republics-republic-is-dying/
All withdrawals after registration endorsed Raisi. Has name recognition from the previous election as a challenger to Rouhani.
The Council of Guardians has eliminated all of the other serious candidates, clearing the way for Raisi.[1] [1] https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/28/world/middleeast/iran-election-khamenei-raisi.html
Kind of a question, that i will learn more than i will improve my personal results.
